conclusion: Determine the propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo.
Refractive index of water is approximated as 1.33.
Calculate the speed of light in water using v = c/n.
Speed of light in water is approximately 2.26 x 10^8 m/s.
Light ray enters at A, reflects at B, exits at C in the water polo.
Determine the total path length L of light inside the water polo.
Angle of incidence i is 30 degrees.
Use Snell's law to find angle of refraction r.
Angle of refraction r is approximately 22.09 degrees.
Radius of inner circle is R, outer circle is 8R/3.
Calculate distance AB using geometry of the circle.
Distance BC is the same as AB due to symmetry.
Calculate propagation time t using t = L/v.
Propagation time t is approximately 6.65 x 10^-9 R seconds.
